title: How to Make Lobster Macaroni and Cheese

steps.headline: Bring a pot of salted water to boil and cook the macaroni.
steps.description: Boil the macaroni for about 7-10 minutes, until it has fully cooked but is slightly tender.

steps.headline: Drain the pasta into a colander.
Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (175° Celsius).
Combine the cheeses in a double boiler.
steps.description: Add the cheddar, Gruyere, cream cheese, and only four ounces of the Parmesan cheese. Gently mix with a whisk over medium heat until it begins to melt.

steps.headline: Pour in the cream and whisk once more.
steps.description: Stir until well combined and smooth. Set aside.

steps.headline: Add the oil, shallots, and garlic into a large saucepan.
steps.description: Saute the ingredients together over medium heat until they begin to lightly brown, taking about 7-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Fold in the lobster meat.
steps.description: Continue stirring and cooking until the lobster turns opaque.

steps.headline: Combine the pasta with the cheese sauce, lobster mixture, salt and pepper.
steps.description: Mix with a wooden spoon until the pasta is well-incorporated and fully coated with cheese sauce.

steps.headline: Place the macaroni into a casserole dish.
steps.description: Evenly spread the macaroni and cheese in its casserole baking dish. Sprinkle over the breadcrumbs and remaining Parmesan cheese on top. Don't be afraid to add additional toppings on top of the macaroni. Examples include crumbled blue cheese, crushed red pepper flakes, or diced bacon.

steps.headline: Bake the macaroni and cheese for about 6-8 minutes.
steps.description: Cook until the breadcrumbs begin to crisp and turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the macaroni into a serving plate. Garnish with extra Parmesan cheese or shredded basil if desired. Enjoy!

text: Bring a pot of salted water to boil and cook the macaroni. Boil the macaroni for about 7-10 minutes, until it has fully cooked but is slightly tender. Drain the pasta into a colander. Set aside for later use. Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (175° Celsius).  Combine the cheeses in a double boiler. Add the cheddar, Gruyere, cream cheese, and only four ounces of the Parmesan cheese. Gently mix with a whisk over medium heat until it begins to melt. Pour in the cream and whisk once more. Stir until well combined and smooth. Set aside. Add the oil, shallots, and garlic into a large saucepan. Saute the ingredients together over medium heat until they begin to lightly brown, taking about 7-10 minutes. Fold in the lobster meat. Continue stirring and cooking until the lobster turns opaque. Combine the pasta with the cheese sauce, lobster mixture, salt and pepper. Mix with a wooden spoon until the pasta is well-incorporated and fully coated with cheese sauce. Place the macaroni into a casserole dish. Evenly spread the macaroni and cheese in its casserole baking dish. Sprinkle over the breadcrumbs and remaining Parmesan cheese on top. Don't be afraid to add additional toppings on top of the macaroni. Examples include crumbled blue cheese, crushed red pepper flakes, or diced bacon. Bake the macaroni and cheese for about 6-8 minutes. Cook until the breadcrumbs begin to crisp and turn golden brown. Serve. Scoop the macaroni into a serving plate. Garnish with extra Parmesan cheese or shredded basil if desired. Enjoy!
